revisions.rev:
{{Infobox school|name=Davis High School | image=[[Image:Dhslogo.png]] | type=Public, Senior High School | principal=Dee Burton | faculty=133 | grades=10-12 | enrollment=2,408 | class=~800 | mascot=Dart | colors=Brown, Gold | address=325 South Main Street | city=[[Kaysville, Utah]] | zip=84037 | coordinates={{Coord|41|01|45|N|111|55|50|W|type:landmark|display=inline,title}} | phone=801-402-8800 | website=http://www.davis.k12.ut.us/708/site/default.asp }}
'''Davis High School''' is a [[Public school (government funded)|public school]] located in [[Kaysville, Utah|Kaysville]], [[Utah]], [[United States]]. It is a member of the [[Davis School District]]. The mascot of Davis High School is a Dart. The school was established in 1914 and underwent reconstruction during the 2003-2004 school year.<ref>[http://dhs.davis.k12.ut.us/AboutUs/NW%20Booklet_files/page0008.htm About us] on school web site</ref>
==Academics== Davis High School had the highest number of [[Advanced Placement|AP]] exams taken (1,345) as well as the highest percent of AP exams passed (83.5%) within the state of Utah.<ref>[http://deseretnews.com/article/1,5143,695205359,00.html Utahns top U.S. on SAT, AP tests] by Jennifer Toomer-Cook in Deseret Morning News, August 29, 2007</ref> Davis High School also has an extremely high graduation rate, at 98.6% during the 2005-2006 school year.<ref>[http://www.davis.k12.ut.us/rad/pdfs/AP_Reports/708.pdf Annual Performance Reports] from school web site</ref>
==Marching Band== The Davis High School Marching Band has always had long tradition of excellence throughout their band program. In the past the band has been a 2000, 2008, 2009, 2010 and 2011 Bands of America regional finalist (in which it has finished in the top 5), and participated in the Rose Parade of 2003, and has been invited to return to the Rose Parade in 2013. The DHS band program continues to provide state recognition.
Their 2011 field show entitled ''Boo! In the Hall of the Mountain King'', took either first or second in every Utah competition, including a 3rd place finish in the Bands of America Regional championship.<ref>[http://my.hsj.org/Schools/Newspaper/tabid/100/view/frontpage/schoolid/733/articleid/466834/newspaperid/709/Band_makes_a_breakthrough.aspx] from the school's newspaper</ref>
==Athletics== The Darts participate in class 5-A,<ref>[http://www.uhsaa.org/info/index.php?option=com_wrapper&Itemid=108] from Utah High School Athletics Association website</ref> the highest classification of high school athletics in the state of Utah. They consistently rank among the states top teams in overall sports{{Citation needed|date=August 2008}}. The Darts won the Utah class 5-A state basketball championship in 2002 and the state 5-A football championship in 2004{{Citation needed|date=August 2008}}. Davis won back to back state championships in hockey. Their first victory came in 2001 with a win over rival Viewmont, the other in 2002 with a win over Brighton. Davis also was the recipient of the Utah High School Activities Association All-Sports Award for the 2004-2005 school year, winning it again for the 2009-2010 school year.

|}<ref>[http://www.davis.k12.ut.us/dhs/Clubs/index.htm List of clubs] on school web site</ref>
==School Store== [[Image:Thepointlogo.png|right|]]Davis High School has a student-run school store called "The Point" open every day at lunch. The Point sells desserts, drinks, and various lunch items as well as school apparel. The store is run by students in the retail class, part of the School of Business.<ref>[http://ps.webstorepackage.com/hotc/DavisDarts/ Davis Darts] school store web site</ref>
Davis High School's former building, which stood from 1914 until 2003, housed a school store called The Canteen. Like The Point, this location offered a selection of food and beverage items as well as school-related merchandise.{{Citation needed|date=August 2008}}
==Davis Dart== The Davis Dart is the official news publication for the school.{{Citation needed|date=August 2008}} The student staff is collectively referred to as the Dart Staff.{{Citation needed|date=August 2008}} The publication is released each term. However, the Dart Staff Website is updated bi-weekly. DTV is the broadcast news side of the Davis Dart and is released every other week during advisories. {{Citation needed|date=August 2008}}
==Rivalries== Davis has not one but four rivalries with [[Viewmont High School]], [[Northridge High School (Layton, Utah)|Northridge High School]], [[American Fork High School]], and [[Layton High School]]{{Citation needed|date=August 2008}}. Viewmont and Davis are crosstown rivals and have recently been at the top of the Region 1 standings in most major sports.<ref>[http://deseretnews.com/article/1,5143,695213526,00.html Viewmont, Davis prepare for rivalry] by Dan Rasmussen in Deseret Morning News, September 27, 2007</ref>
Similarly, Layton High School and Davis High School have had a rivalry for years. Incidents have included vandalism of football fields, graffiti on school buildings, and violence at sporting events.<ref>[http://sports.espn.go.com/sports/news/story?id=2600409 Thumbtack prank backfires on prep football player] by Associated Press, September 2006</ref>
The Rivalry between Davis and American Fork is primarily between the two school's Marching Band and Cross Country Programs. In the Battle of the Bands, Davis and American Fork are regularly competing for the top spot in Utah competitions. In Cross Country the school's are always close in competitions, and both are ranked in the top twenty five nationally.
==Notable alumni== * [[Bernard Francis Fisher]] - First living member of the United States Air Force to receive the [[Medal of Honor]].<ref>[http://www.af.mil/news/story.asp?id=123097650, "Medal of Honor recipient receives diploma"] The Official Website of the U.S. Air Force</ref> * [[Calvin L. Rampton]] - 11th Governor of Utah.<ref>[http://historytogo.utah.gov/people/calvinlrampton.html] From Utah state history website</ref> * [[Rob Bishop]] - Republican member of the U.S. House of Representatives.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://robbishop.house.gov/Biography/|title=Rob Bishop biography}}</ref> * [[Jill Stevens]] - Miss Utah 2007.<ref>[http://www.deseretnews.com/dn/view/0,1249,680195988,00.html Miss Utah is medic for Utah Guard] by Stephan Speckman in Deseret News, July 3, 2007</ref> * [[Nolan Bushnell]] - Founder of Atari Corporation, developer of Pong<ref>[http://davis_high_school__kaysville__utah.totallyexplained.com/] Davis High School Totally Explained</ref>
